She Just Proved Me Wrong Again

â¤ï¸ Krishna Chaitanya March 3, 2025

No, she just made me feel terrible. Yesterday was my birthday, and she didnâ€™t even wish me. Not a call, not a message, nothing. I waited the whole day, checking my phone every few minutes like a fool, hoping to see her name pop up. But nothing happened.

And then todayâ€¦ she finally sent a message. March 3rd, at 12:50 AM. A simple birthday wish. But by then, it was too late. Too late for it to mean anything. I saw it when I woke up at 6 AM, and honestly, I didnâ€™t even feel anything anymore. Just disappointment. It was like she had fallen straight into my little test. I changed my birthday just to see who actually remembered without a reminder, and she failed.

But what really got me was something else. On Saturday, March 1st, she messaged me at 11:30 PM. Just a casual â€œhloo.â€ At that moment, I thought, â€œOkay, maybe she remembers, maybe sheâ€™s about to wish me.â€ But no. Nothing came after that. She just left it at that, and the next day passed without a word.

So in the end, she did wish meâ€”but only because she saw a notification on Snapchat. Just like everyone else. Just like it was nothing special. Thatâ€™s what hurt the most. After all these years, after everything, I was just another name on her screen.

I didnâ€™t even know what to reply. I just sent a simple ğŸ™. Nothing more. Nothing less. What was there left to say?

All these years, Iâ€™ve thought about her, watched her, tried to understand her. And here she is, making me feel like the biggest idiot in the world. Like I was the only one who ever cared. Maybe I was. And maybe thatâ€™s the saddest part of all.
